creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Audrey Seo and Stephen Addiss
description: two rubbings mounted one on top of the other; top image: portrait of man with head turned 3/4 toward PR; man has large nose and ear, wears kimono with round designs and holds paintbrush in PR hand; bottom image: large lotus blossom with large leaves; brown mount; ceramic roller ends with blue floral designs
dimension:
22 1/2 × 23 1/4 in. (57.15 × 59.06 cm) (image, top image; "Self-Portrait")
23 × 23 in. (58.42 × 58.42 cm) (image, bottom image; "Lotus")
76 1/4 × 28 7/16 in. (193.68 × 72.23 cm) (without rollers)
markings: ULC below signature on top rubbing, two seals: 1: {Sugai ____ } (square relief); 2. Not read (square intaglio)
title: Self-Portrait and Lotus
